content.rendered:
The shipping industry is one of the oldest, yet very important in the world of trade. Shipping still plays a critical role in the modern business world, facilitating active trade in raw materials, automobiles, consumer goods, fuel, and so on. Today over 100,000 cargo ships are involved in trade, representing over 150 countries, transporting over 20 million containers every day, across the globe. The industry has also provided employment for millions of people around the world.

In Kenya, the shipping industry plays a critical role in facilitating different areas of commerce. More people are venturing into business in the country and are relying on shipping companies to transport their goods into and out of the country.

If you are looking to venture into exporting and importing cargo, you need to partner with a reliable shipping company to make it happen. Here is a list of renowned shipping companies in Kenya.

1. States Duka

States Duka is among the most reliable shipping companies in Kenya. The company also operates in Uganda, USA, South Sudan, and Tanzania. Its multinational footprint speaks volumes of the company’s experience in the shipping industry. In order to make its operations seamless and streamlined, States Duka has partnered with ecommerce companies such as Amazon, eBay, and Jiji to export cargo to and from the USA and East Africa. It is also worth noting that the company’s specialty is in air shipping, and it is one of the reasons it charges $15 per kilogram of cargo.

Get to know more about the Tendering Process in Kenya

2. Century Cargo Shipping Company

The shipping company is located right in the middle of a shipping operations city, Mombasa. Century Cargo shipping is a one-stop-shop for shipping services. The company provides both importers and exporters a wide array of shipping services.

The company also boasts being one of the oldest shipping companies in Kenya, further proving its credibility and reliability. Transportation and warehousing are some of the additional services that the company offers. If you are looking for a fully-fledged shipping services provider, you might want to look in this direction.

3. Filiken Transit Forwarders Ltd

Filiken Transit Forwarders Limited is located in Mombasa, where it can directly control port operations. The company’s field of expertise in the shipping industry is transportation logistics. Their services also include transportation support activities such as warehousing and motoring. You know where to look if you are looking for shipping and transportation services.

4. Mahdi Logistics

Mahdi Logistics is among the shipping companies in Kenya that have managed to build a name for themselves. It is among the few shipping companies that have diversified their services, allowing their clients to enjoy a full range supply chain process. On top of shipping, Mahdi has also ventured into wholesale and retail services.

Here is a guide of how Forex Trading in Kenya works.

5. Zam Zam Shipping Limited

Zam Zam Shipping Limited is a recognized player in the shipping industry in Kenya. The company is a provider of logistics and maritime support services, and shipping lines and agents along the Indian Ocean Coast.

The company has been in operation for over 15 years, showing its expertise in the field. The company boasts a team of motivated, dedicated, and experienced professionals in operations in the maritime industry. The list of services offered by Zam Zam Shipping Limited includes cargo supervision, draft survey coordination, bunker delivery coordination, and port rotation planning, to mention a few.

6. Crono Company Limited

Crono Company Limited handles clearing and forwarding of a wide range of cargo at Mombasa port. Crono Company Limited was established in 1996, making it one of the region’s oldest shipping companies. The company is located in Malindi. Crono offers a range of tailormade shipping services, which include logistics, storage among many other shipping support services.

7. Emirates Shipping East Africa Limited

Emirates shipping company is located in Mombasa; it is a leader in the shipping industry in Kenya. The company is dedicated to offering its clients world-class transportation services into and out of Africa, the Middle East, the Indian subcontinent, and China.

The team is made of passionate, committed, and experienced shipping professionals from different corners of the globe.

8. Sivicom Liners Limited

Sivicom Liners Limited is a reliable agent for exports and imports. The company is dedicated to helping its clients with clearing and forwarding freight, facilitating the export of cargo through air transportation, among many other services.

Sivicom Liners Limited transport cargo to all parts of the world, and you can rely on them for all your shipping needs.

9. Inchcape Shipping Services

Inchcape Shipping Services is located in Mombasa and is a provider of fully-fledged shipping services. Inchcape works hand in hand with port agency partners to provide their clients with complete shipping services. They include crew logistics, dry docking, crew logistics, and so on.

The company also provides marine support services, which include logistics and freight forwarding, inspection services for cargo, and consultancy services. The company also incorporates modern technology in its operations for effective solutions.

Here is Guide of how Mobile Loans in Kenya may help you to get a significant change.

10. Bollore Africa Logistics Kenya Limited

Bollore is a recognized shipping company located in Nairobi. The company offers a full range of shipping services and walks with their clients from the first step to the completion of the shipping operations. The company operates as a shipping agency in Mombasa, serves as a dry port operator at the Mombasa Container Terminal, imports and exports goods, and tracking and tracing goods in transit.

Bollore also offers air freight services, support services in freight forwarding, and even local transportation. If you need warehousing services, Bollore Africa Logistics Kenya Limited is ready to offer those services too.

International trade has been Kenya’s economic fuel for a long time. Through the import and export of goods, many Kenyans have been able to get employment and generate steady income. The shipping companies listed above, among many others, have made it happen. The shipping companies provide a wide range of services, some specializing in given areas. If you are looking to venture into the import and export business, look for reliable partners in the industry to succeed in your venture.
